alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 2:32AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, north central Rutherford and central Wilson Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over La Vergne, or 14 miles northwest of Murfreesboro, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Smyrna, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Rural Hill, Belinda City, Tuckers Crossroads and Gladeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 225 and 247. Interstate 840 between mile markers 63 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
